revised_title: Investigating Spark Breakdown Mechanisms in Nitrogen, Oxygen, and Sulphur Hexafluoride
tldr: The authors investigate the growth of ionization and spark breakdown in nitrogen, oxygen, and sulphur hexafluoride using an image converter and a 4-stage image intensifier. They observe the development of ionization from the start of the primary avalanche to the intense filamentary discharge channel. The results indicate that the development of breakdown in electro-negative gases like oxygen and sulphur hexafluoride is not fully described by existing theories of ionization growth.
